page.title: 14Cowbridge Cattle Market
page.content: We visited Cowbridge Market on 14th May 1985. Cowbridge market is open every Tuesday. Farmers come to buy, sell and look at animals. Some come locally and others come from further away. There were about 60 people there. The type of animals bought were sheep, calves, cows and piglets. The breeds of cattle were Friesions and Hereford Reds. A farmer told us that a fat lamb would cost Â£50, a dairy cow would cost Â£450, a Jersey cow would cost Â£250, a bore Â£30 and a sow Â£90. Unbought animals are slaughtered. John Morgan is one of five auctioneers. He pays with the other four auctioneers to keep the 100 year old cattle market in good condition. John Morgan has been auctioneering for over ten years. He only handles livestock.
